title: [K-12] Introduction to Literate Programming for Earth Observation Data Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematical knowledge and basic Python programming skills
context.additional_context: Cultivating Problem-Solving Abilities Using Earth Observation Data for Career Preparers in Medical/Legal/Technical Fields

learning_goals: Learners can input atmospheric composition data (e.g., temperature, humidity, CO2 concentration) in a Jupyter Notebook environment and write and execute three types of Python code using basic functions (pandas, matplotlib) to calculate averages/maximum values and generate visualization graphs.
Generate documentation with a 3:1 text:code ratio following literate programming principles
Perform preprocessing and visualization of satellite observation data using modularized functions

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
